We are advanced in POCUS, and offer tracks in Primary Care, Geriatrics, and Inclusion Health (Street Medicine, Addiction Medicine, Jail Medicine etc.) Our Research Institute supports our residents with bioinformatics, biostatistics, and medical writing, and we accomplish all of this in a culture where we take medicine seriously, but don't take ourselves too seriously!

The hospital is jointly owned by Ballad Health and Johnston Memorial Hospital. This program provides a great opportunity to train in rural internal medicine in the beautiful, historic town of Abingdon, VA in the mountains of Southwest Virginia.

column20: This combined medicine-dermatology residency program is designed to prepare residents for careers in both internal medicine and dermatology. Our learning and teaching style emphasizes: experiential and active learning; close mentorship in a challenging, yet fostering academic environment; camaraderie and teamwork. Each resident has graded responsibilities in medicine and dermatology throughout the training, including weekly continuity clinics in both medicine and dermatology.

column20: Our program is built on 2 solid accredited core programs established > 50 years ago. Our hospitals have the most interesting and complex cases from all over the island. Our residents are very proficient in procedures as well as great teachers since we are affiliated to our Island's largest medical school. You're required to be fully bilingual(Spanish/English). It's the only one located on a tropical island, so if you're looking for some warm weather and all of the above this program is for you!

The dedicated medicine/pediatrics resident clinic is NCQA-accredited Level III PCMH. Highly supportive faculty; residents mentored to diverse career options including fellowship, primary care, hospitalist and other leadership roles. Specialized tracks in research, global health, clinician educator and women's health.

column20: Our training year is comprised of 13 four-week blocks--six medicine, six psychiatry, and one split block. While on medicine, one week of each block is dedicated to specialty services, ambulatory clinics (both medicine and psychiatry) and board preparation. Our residents are active participants in their own training, and their feedback is a huge part of our success. The success of our graduates is well established and includes progression to fellowship programs, academic and community psychiatry.

column20: Our primary goal is to develop well-rounded, thoughtful, technically sound, and clinically competent interventional radiologists. The program offers a heavy focus on the development of diagnostic radiology skills in PGY1-3 of training, with the majority of rotations taking place in the diagnostic reading rooms. The training during PGY4-5 will consist with the majority of rotations in interventional radiology.

Residents are in IR-focused training in PGY5-6. All take the American College of Radiology In-Training Examination. A board review program, physics course, study groups with faculty prepare for success on the ABR examination.

column20: This program is a categorical 6-year program consisting of a world-class surgical preliminary year, followed by a comprehensive 5-year integrated IR residency program of radiologic diagnosis, procedures, and patient care. Residents concentrate on diagnostic radiology during the PGY2 to PGY4 years and interventional radiology during the PGY5 and PGY6 years. Training is provided in all aspects of diagnosis and management by a talented and motivated faculty at a diverse array of training sites.

column20: The primary objective is to train a physician in medical genetics so that he/she can function independently as a subspecialist in this field. At the end of the training the resident trainee should have acquired enough training, expertise, and experience to pursue an academic or clinical career. Two basic necessities emphasized for this training program are clinical care and research. Each of these components is given equal importance during the two years of training.

column20: We are committed to excellence in diagnosing and treating neurological disorders and discovering new treatments in a caring, patient-centered environment. column20: The National Institutes of Health (NIH) offers an innovative 7-year neurological surgery residency training program in collaboration with the University of Virginia. The primary objective of our residency program is to train outstanding clinical neurosurgeons with unparalleled experience and expertise in laboratory and clinical research who become academic leaders in neurosurgery. The NIH Loan Repayment Program is available to program residents.

column20: The Neurosurgery Program at Henry Ford is designed to prepare residents for careers as surgeons, clinicians, academicians and future leaders.  We have an excellent volume, mix and complexity of cases; commitment to the acquisition of new technologies; humanistic, nationally recognized, academically productive faculty; and an amazing, diverse resident group who support and enjoy working with one another.  Their education is fully supported including resourced anatomy labs and research support.

column20: Our program's strengths are our high clinical volume, diverse case types, and dedicated faculty notable for its breadth and depth of training. All our core faculty are fellowship-trained neurosurgeons and orthopedic spine surgeons who are experienced in surgical education. Our strongest case types include spine surgery, cerebrovascular neurosurgery, endovascular intervention, and skull base surgery with one of the highest volumes of acoustic neuroma in the country.

column20: We offer an intimate, multi-faceted neurosurgical training experience. We are renowned for: Introducing dexamethasone to treat cerebral edema; Pioneering research in stem cell therapies; Collaborating with medical device center to develop, apply and improve technologies associated with DBS to treat Parkinson's disease; Applying cancer vaccine therapy to treat brain tumors; Developing groundbreaking procedures using intraoperative MRI surgery; and treating brain trauma using hyperbaric oxygen.

We pride ourselves on training excellent academic and clinical neurosurgeons, by offering a broad exposure to a large and diverse number of operative procedures. Our commitment to research offers exposure to academic and scientific principles that will help define the future of neurosurgery.

column20: The Inova neurological surgery residency is a comprehensive education program that incorporates didactics, clinical practice and simulation across all neurosurgical subspecialty areas. Inova provides a competitive benefits program that includes vacation, sick, and holiday pay. Health insurance programs include medical, vision, prescription, and dental insurance. Additional benefits include disability, 401K/403B plans, 529 college savings plan, a stipend for conferences/books and other benefits.

column20: We offer comprehensive training in all subspecialty areas of neurology including behavioral, movement, muscular, MS, epilepsy, neuro-immunology, stroke, neuro-ophth, neuroID and neuro-onc. Our program offers training at four highly-regarded academic hospitals, which creates exposure to diverse patient populations. Denver is a vibrant metropolitan community with many cultural attractions. The beauty of the Rocky Mountains is easily accessible, and the climate of Colorado is incomparable.
